item.description: Interview with Meghan McCabe and Marina Classen, representatives from the F Word Conference. item.title: Broadcast on [9-Nov-2013]
item.description: Common Vernacular Industries continues their earnest propaganda campaign with a two hour guest spot on Synaptic Sandwich. Curated by Common Vernacular Industries Official Spokesperson, the program could accurately be described by such phrases as "fun-filled," "not un-cool," and "headache inducing." CVI thanks you for your time and attention and wishes you the best Remembrance day in recent memory for you to remember, always.

item.title: Warren::Peace Hour w/ Oppaa (Vancouver, BC)
item.description: Producer and UBC student Oppaa in the studio with Warren::peace playing new electronica and hip hop from British Columbia// Artists such as: Astrological, Potatohead People, Kline, and others. Playing some Dnb from around town produced by local cats such as Mat The Alien, Max Ulis etc. Montreal dj Jacques Greene also makes an appearance. Constantly showcasing new Vancouver talent and from abroad, this is an hour you should not miss. *Fresh like baby powder*
item.itunes:subtitle: Oppaa in the studio with warren::peace, pickin' fresh tracks and talkin' smack

item.title: Melanie Coles
item.description: This week's episode featured the latest and greatest new releases on the CiTR playlist such as War on Drugs, Weed and several tracks off the new Nite Prison LP. Featured were indie rock legends who released solo albums in 2011 with the likes of Stephen Malkmus (of Pavement) J Mascis (of Dinosaur Jr) and Stephen Merritt(of Magnetic Fields). Thrown in were classic tracks from Yo La Tengo and Jesus and Mary Chain mixed with C86 inspired Billiant Colors from their recent release Again and Again on Slumberland records. Also from the Slumberland roster we heard the track Your Sympathy from Devon Williams new release Euphoria.
item.itunes:subtitle: Legends of the Nineteen Nineties
